posts.title: US Supreme Court upholds order to facilitate return of deportee sent to El Salvador in error
top_comments: I can't believe it takes an order from the Supreme Court when it was in error. That is so mind-bendingly fucked up.
The fact that a sitting president said NO to an innocent man returning home from an another countries shitty prison after being forcefully detained and sent there for no reason is fucking disgusting.

The fact that this had to go to the SC instead of the administration just doing what was obviously the correct and just thing to do (ignoring the premise of these deportations entirely) is a travesty and really shows the true colors of these motherfuckers.

"We know what we did is wrong, but like...why are you trying to make us correct it!? So unfair!"

This should have been common sense, the fact that the administration fought this - the fact they were not willing to bring back this person - this is not American, any individual who supports this administration needs a bit of a reality check. We have come so far off the course of any human decency.
I think anyone that was part of sending this man down there without due process should be shipped to the same prison for the same amount of time.
Now we see what happens if the executive branch says “nah”
Can’t wait for Trump Admin people to start talking about abolishing the SC for going against their idol.
Finally some good fucking news. At least the Trump admin can’t send people to El Salvador and lose the key.

It's not a win, yet: "However, the court said that the additional requirement to "effectuate" his return was unclear and may exceed the judge's authority. The justices directed Xinis to clarify the directive "with due regard for the deference owed to the executive branch in the conduct of foreign affairs."" 


They want the judge to explain how the government should bring him back, which isn't the judge's job. They're still giving the government a lot of wiggle room.

[Leah Litman](https://bsky.app/profile/leahlitman.bsky.social/post/3lmiljosr5s2u) (very smart source) is concerned the wording gives the government wiggle room to just say “Sorry, we can’t convince El Salvador to bring him back”

(Horrific nonsense of course but that will be the next move)

posts.title: China strikes back with 125% tariffs on U.S. goods, starting April 12
top_comments:
> “Even if the U.S. continues to impose higher tariffs, it will no longer make economic sense and will become a joke in the history of world economy,” the statement said, according to a CNBC translation.


That statement is going to cause a major tantrum in the administration.

Well, congratulations are in order, US.


You made China, South Korea and Japan sit at the table and start to negotiate a trade deal between them.


Not bad. 😁🫢

The America led clownshow continues.

Good job, idiots.

It's an effective trade halt between China and the US. 

In 2024, the US exported $143.5 billion in goods to China and imported $438 billion from China.

Recession is basically guaranteed at this point. We'll be lucky if it's not a depression.
Future comedians will use 21th century history as research material.
This is too much foreplay at this point. Just cut to the chase and will someone just impose 500% tariff already?

It doesn't even matter what the tariff % raises to, they're already high enough that trade has ceased. They're always going to stay just lower than the US tariffs to make clear they are not the aggressor here. But Trump will keep raising them as long as he doesn't have the last word. Someone needs to call his bluff, and I'm glad China has the balls and poker hand to do it. It's not even a matter of who blinks first, because it's 100% going to be Trump, it's just a matter of how much damage he does for how long.
Yay, can't wait to pay $100 for something that costs $1 to produce. Proud to be American.
That fucking clown in the whitehouse is going to bankrupt us like one of his casinos.

It's meaningless actually, as Chinese I would say. 84% tariff is enough to eliminate American goods in China market.

I personally think that if our speaker simply speak so, it may be more helpful, make orange man look less rational.

But to be honest, I don't think we have much cards to play, except a trump card, not recognizing American patents. But that's nuclear weapon level measure, no one would foresee the next.

posts.title: Donald Trump signs order to 'make America's showers great again'
top_comments: What about America's growers?

Another thing to try to distract us from the Dow losing over 1,000 points today. 

I’m exhausted

He's ignoring due process. He's defying court orders. He's destroying the executive branch. Oh, and he's a twice impeached convicted felon. But, water pressure. Let's drop everything and talk about water pressure for rest of the day.

> This served “a radical green agenda that made life worse for Americans”, the White House said, as Trump criticised the “ridiculous” amount of time he says it takes to wet his hair in the shower.

Oh c’mon, assuming he’s referring to the hair on his head, he has like…11 strands at most there, all hanging on for dear life. The aerosolized mist from a flushing toilet could render that wisp of straw sopping wet.

He's always hated low-flow shower heads.  He made a similar executive order in his first term, which Biden cancelled.  So he's doing it again.

Who cares that fresh water is getting more scarce with the progression of climate change.  Trump wants a powerful shower!
I wonder where he had that idea?
There’s this great onion article from about 25 years ago heralding passage of the “Universal Lawn Care Act” and it feels like Trump is just recycling this stuff now.
My shower is fine bro can you focus more on not destroying our economy? Thanks
Make showers golden again

The most pathetically embarrassing president I've ever seen.

The cabinet meeting he had today was nothing short of North Korea vibes. Every single person was praising how amazing he was and how wonderful job he's doing. 

He can do no wrong. Everything he does is perfect. He will no doubt run for a 3rd term because the republicans have no spine and don't believe the constitution applies to him.

posts.title: Planes clip wings at DCA with members of Congress on board
top_comments:
Based on the tweets, looks like 3 Congresspeople were involved:

* Josh Gottheimer - NJ (Dem)
* Nick LaLota - NY (Rep)
* Grace Meng - NY (Dem)
Flying to DCA is like playing a game of Russian Roulette.
Now Congress will finally do something about it. Because Congress, especially Republicans, don't take any action unless it benefits them.

I hope this is a reminder to policymakers that when we say the agencies and programs they’re defunding benefit everyone, we literally mean *everyone*. Safety in transportation, health, food, weather — I could go on — is everyone’s business.
Maybe dismantling the FAA was not a good idea?

>“Aviation mishaps are at an all-time high, and the Trump administration's reckless decision to fire FAA control staff has put us all in danger.”

Honestly, it's scary, you know, thinking about how quickly things can go wrong, especially when critical safety measures are cut... the political games shouldn't be interfering with something so vital, and I really hope those involved in this incident are okay, because that's the main thing, and it does make you think twice about flying.
DOGE gutting the FAA means this will be increasingly common.
If only Congress had some kind of funding and oversight role... Oh well...

I’m about to google their voting records.  I was talking to people at work about how after the first few times I just thought the media was giving it extra attention because it was already in the cycle but it was getting weird, that was a few weeks ago

Why is it significant who was on board?  Don’t regular moms, dads, kids matter?  Should we all say “Oh no!  Not members of Congress”.  How about just report fully loaded passenger planes clipped wings??

posts.title: Tourist helicopter crashes in Hudson River in New York City, all 6 on board killed
top_comments: Those helicopter tours are once in a lifetime kinda thing for tourists. They’re not particularly cheap, but an incredible and unforgettable experience while visiting the city. This is so so so upsetting, they could be anybody.

When I was a kid around ‘77ish we took a helicopter tour around The Queen Mary in Long Beach. Few days later that helicopter crashed killing all onboard. My Dad was white as a ghost for a few weeks after that. Never seen him scared before.
Does anyone remember the traffic reporter who went down in the helicopter during a report?  Her words still HAUNT me - I can hear it vividly to this day.  RIP
Those poor people. Can't imagine the terror they experienced...I just hope it was quick.

when you think about it, those helicopters are going on, what, 5-10 trips or more a day? are they maintained properly?

this is so unbelievable - my heart is shattered for that family, pilot & their loved ones.

From what I read of the article something hit the rotor, busted off a chunk of one and a fragment hit the engine causing it to explode and fall into the river. At least that's what I was able to gather. What the hell could do that to a helicopter? A drone maybe?
Oh shit. That poor family and pilot’s family members . How terrifying. Can we just stop with the sassy comments?
This fucking year man.

Could you imagine, the end of the line. 

You did everything right, got to the top of your industry, beautiful family, on vacation. And in an instant. Your lineage ends. 

Then there's me, bottom. Surviving.

RIP.
I saw a pic of the family. Cute kids. An absolute tragedy. 🥺

posts.title: USDA to close down DC headquarters, lay off thousands of workers: report
top_comments:
As an FYI- the USDA is not just food. They also oversee RD, or Rural Development which a portion of subsidized housing very similar to HUD or Section 8. This housing subsidy helps very low income households pay rent each month. 

  
Losing funding would make millions of people homeless.

What the fuck. 

So we can't get fruit from Mexico and our own farms no longer have insurance to cover the increasing terrible storms
Cool, this should have zero negative ramifications
This is a plot to get more small farms to fail so large corps can buy the land
I've been watching the new Daredevil series. Every episode, I'm disappointed by the sad truth that Wilson Fisk is less destructive than our own president.
Eh, my food was too safe anyway. Time to take a life altering gamble every time I eat a meal I guess....
Welcome to The Jungle
USDA's main funding—70% is to school lunch, WIC, SNAP and rural home loans. Crop insurance and rural infrastructure are important too. Gonna be a big hit to rural schools combined with DOE cuts.
Glad I’m not looking for jobs in DC, which would probably going to be the unemployment capital of the U.S.

Its so wonderful to wake up each day, go online, and see what other terrible, unconstitutional, illegal ccr4p Felon47 has done to further destroy our once great nation....i pr4y daily that you know who has a massive myocardial infarction....

posts.title: Fast fashion items overwhelm Sweden’s recycling centres
top_comments: We need to rethink our continued purchase of utter junk from SHEIN to Temu, and of course Sweden’s great gift to the world H&M - which was a main starter of this trend

> Swedes throw away 90,000 tonnes of textiles per year, or 10kg per person, according to the Swedish Society for the Conservation of Nature.

> The EU average is 19kg

I'm maybe at 1Kg max, considering year where I don't even throw any clothes are common, I'm not even sure it's worth for me to talk in year. 

WTF is wrong with people.
Pretty much every time I walked pass clothing shops and just wondering who the fuck is buying all these clothes.
Nobody needs fast fashion. Let's stop wasting precious resources on bullshit.

> 2,500 litres of water and one kilogramme of chemicals are needed to make a T-shirt that weighs 135 grammes

Fuck me, humans are a cancer on Planet Earth.

I don't even want to think about how much resources was just wasted by me submitting this comment.

Fast fashion should be banned.  Producing clothes is agriculturally intensive, industrially intensive, and labour intensive.  

Clothes should be made to last.  Fashion should not be something so ugly it has to be changed every 6 months.

I worked at H&M for a while, half of the stuff I saw coming in had button with one stitch keeping them on. I bought clothing there with my employee discount pretty often, my pants buttons always needed the button re-sewn after about a week or two. 

I don’t know why anyone bought it. The employee discount made sense for me, but I never bought there again after I left (no bad blood with the company either, their product just sucks)

They got great benefits though
Ban fashion dictators

posts.title: China strikes back with 125% tariffs on U.S. goods, starting April 12
top_comments:
> “Even if the U.S. continues to impose higher tariffs, it will no longer make economic sense and will become a joke in the history of world economy,” the statement said, according to a CNBC translation.


That statement is going to cause a major tantrum in the administration.

Well, congratulations are in order, US.


You made China, South Korea and Japan sit at the table and start to negotiate a trade deal between them.


Not bad. 😁🫢

The America led clownshow continues.

Good job, idiots.

It's an effective trade halt between China and the US. 

In 2024, the US exported $143.5 billion in goods to China and imported $438 billion from China.

Recession is basically guaranteed at this point. We'll be lucky if it's not a depression.
Future comedians will use 21th century history as research material.
This is too much foreplay at this point. Just cut to the chase and will someone just impose 500% tariff already?

It doesn't even matter what the tariff % raises to, they're already high enough that trade has ceased. They're always going to stay just lower than the US tariffs to make clear they are not the aggressor here. But Trump will keep raising them as long as he doesn't have the last word. Someone needs to call his bluff, and I'm glad China has the balls and poker hand to do it. It's not even a matter of who blinks first, because it's 100% going to be Trump, it's just a matter of how much damage he does for how long.
Yay, can't wait to pay $100 for something that costs $1 to produce. Proud to be American.
That fucking clown in the whitehouse is going to bankrupt us like one of his casinos.

It's meaningless actually, as Chinese I would say. 84% tariff is enough to eliminate American goods in China market.

I personally think that if our speaker simply speak so, it may be more helpful, make orange man look less rational.

But to be honest, I don't think we have much cards to play, except a trump card, not recognizing American patents. But that's nuclear weapon level measure, no one would foresee the next.

posts.title: Tourist helicopter crashes in Hudson River in New York City, all 6 on board killed
top_comments: Those helicopter tours are once in a lifetime kinda thing for tourists. They’re not particularly cheap, but an incredible and unforgettable experience while visiting the city. This is so so so upsetting, they could be anybody.

When I was a kid around ‘77ish we took a helicopter tour around The Queen Mary in Long Beach. Few days later that helicopter crashed killing all onboard. My Dad was white as a ghost for a few weeks after that. Never seen him scared before.
Does anyone remember the traffic reporter who went down in the helicopter during a report?  Her words still HAUNT me - I can hear it vividly to this day.  RIP
Those poor people. Can't imagine the terror they experienced...I just hope it was quick.

when you think about it, those helicopters are going on, what, 5-10 trips or more a day? are they maintained properly?

this is so unbelievable - my heart is shattered for that family, pilot & their loved ones.

From what I read of the article something hit the rotor, busted off a chunk of one and a fragment hit the engine causing it to explode and fall into the river. At least that's what I was able to gather. What the hell could do that to a helicopter? A drone maybe?
Oh shit. That poor family and pilot’s family members . How terrifying. Can we just stop with the sassy comments?
This fucking year man.

Could you imagine, the end of the line. 

You did everything right, got to the top of your industry, beautiful family, on vacation. And in an instant. Your lineage ends. 

Then there's me, bottom. Surviving.

RIP.
I saw a pic of the family. Cute kids. An absolute tragedy. 🥺

posts.title: US Supreme Court upholds order to facilitate return of deportee sent to El Salvador in error
top_comments: I can't believe it takes an order from the Supreme Court when it was in error. That is so mind-bendingly fucked up.
The fact that a sitting president said NO to an innocent man returning home from an another countries shitty prison after being forcefully detained and sent there for no reason is fucking disgusting.

The fact that this had to go to the SC instead of the administration just doing what was obviously the correct and just thing to do (ignoring the premise of these deportations entirely) is a travesty and really shows the true colors of these motherfuckers.

"We know what we did is wrong, but like...why are you trying to make us correct it!? So unfair!"

This should have been common sense, the fact that the administration fought this - the fact they were not willing to bring back this person - this is not American, any individual who supports this administration needs a bit of a reality check. We have come so far off the course of any human decency.
I think anyone that was part of sending this man down there without due process should be shipped to the same prison for the same amount of time.
Now we see what happens if the executive branch says “nah”
Can’t wait for Trump Admin people to start talking about abolishing the SC for going against their idol.
Finally some good fucking news. At least the Trump admin can’t send people to El Salvador and lose the key.

It's not a win, yet: "However, the court said that the additional requirement to "effectuate" his return was unclear and may exceed the judge's authority. The justices directed Xinis to clarify the directive "with due regard for the deference owed to the executive branch in the conduct of foreign affairs."" 


They want the judge to explain how the government should bring him back, which isn't the judge's job. They're still giving the government a lot of wiggle room.

[Leah Litman](https://bsky.app/profile/leahlitman.bsky.social/post/3lmiljosr5s2u) (very smart source) is concerned the wording gives the government wiggle room to just say “Sorry, we can’t convince El Salvador to bring him back”

(Horrific nonsense of course but that will be the next move)
